metadata.title: CVE-2023-2166 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A null pointer dereference issue was found in can protocol innet/can/af_can.c in the Linux before Linux. ml_priv may not be initializedin the receive path of CAN frames. A local user could use this flaw tocrash the system or potentially cause a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2166` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-67-generic - 5.15.0-67.74
linux-image-5.15.0-67-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-67.74
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-67-generic - 5.15.0-67.74
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-67-generic-64k - 5.15.0-67.74
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-38-generic - 5.19.0-38.39~22.04.1
linux-image-5.19.0-38-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-38.39~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-38-generic - 5.19.0-38.39~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-38-generic-64k - 5.19.0-38.39~22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-67.74').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-38.39~22.04.1').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1029.34').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1031.35').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1034.41').
linux-azure-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-6.2, was needs-triage').

linux-oem-6.1 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1.0-1004.4').
